short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Bring your characters from paper to life with code!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description:

This course will introduce children to fundamentals of visual programming and digital storytelling. In one week, children will learn how to create their own characters, build animated storylines and develop critical thinking skills by advancing their animation techniques. Students will get to programme their characters by controlling their speed, actions, and adding more of them into their coding projects.

By the end of the course, children will be able to build their own animations, develop various action sequences, and create clips. They will enhance their computational thinking as well as develop creative skills. They will be able to turn their drawn characters into computer animations and create their very own stories.

This is a highly creative course that will help children combine arts and coding. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day. Upon finishing the course, children will get to bring their animations home.

Topics Covered

– Programming with Scratch

– Digital Storytelling

– Action sequence development

– Algorithms and sequences

– Engineering design principles

– Creating sound compositions

– Frame-based animations

– Character animations

– Action sequence development

– Video creation

– 2D and 3D animations

Pre-requisites

Students should be familiar with using a computer, a mouse, and a keyboard. Previous experience with basic coding concepts desired but not a requirement, we will learn everything from scratch! This is a course is ideal for kids aged 7 – 10 who love creating and drawing.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Animation and Coding

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Is your child Minecraft mad?

Turn that love of playing games into a passion for creating them with our four-day modding masterclass.

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

Students will learn how to make their own awesome Minecraft mods throughout the week of creeper smashing, world building and sheep shooting fun. We’ll be using JavaScript and the Blockly programming languages to code and create our own items, weapons, mobs, and games while improving our programming skills.

We’ll learn how to use loops, functions, variables, and conditionals to make a fun summer themed mini-game, complete with our own modded items, mobs, and skins. We’ll also learn how to administer and use JavaScript commands on our own private servers.

This course will challenge our beginner modders ans well as the master modders as lots of challenges and extensions await everyone as they progress throughout the week. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Don’t just leave your child to play Minecraft – get them to create it!

What is Blockly?

Blockly is a graphical block-based programming language designed to ease the transition from Scratch to Javascript. We use blockly as it allows students to get the coding right away without having to worry about making small syntax errors that can frustrate students when they first start to code in JavaScript.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered:

– Fundamentals of Blockly

– Programming with JavaScript

– Logic and conditionals

– Game design and graphics

– Story development

Pre-requisites

Students should be at least a bit familiar with Scratch and may have started to learn Javascript at school or at one of our after-school clubs. They should have played Minecraft before and have sufficient typing and mouse skills.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

Logins and Software: All students should have a working version of Minecraft on their laptops and they will require a purchased account from https://minecraft.net/en

Logins are available to hire for the period of the camp but your child will not be able to use them afterward.

LearnToMod accounts for the use at camp are included in the price.

For more information about LearnToMod please go to https://login-thoughtstem.herokuapp.com/

Please make sure that the laptop your child is bringing is able to run Minecraft and LearnToMod to avoid any technical delays.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!

name: Minecraft Modding

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Launch your kid’s adventure into the digital world!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

Our Scratch programming course builds a strong foundation in computer science and creative problem solving through making animations and games. Over the course of four days, your child will learn to create storylines, programme characters and construct their own games.

This course is perfect for beginners and experienced young coders. Each lesson starts at a gentle pace with lots of extension activities to challenge even the most adept young programmer.

We will be starting each day teaching  touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games and competing in exciting challenges.

We will also make our own game controllers with Makey Makey: a full programme of building and coding is awaiting our young programmers.

In our robotics sessions we will be exploring LEGO WeDo and building robotic LEGO models! LEGO WeDo helps build science, technology and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts. We will learn about Ozobots, build our Mbots, and use our improved Scratch skills to programme our LEGO WeDo creations.

This adventure is fun, entertaining, creative, and most importantly, valuable as children will develop essential computational thinking and creative problem-solving skills. In less than a week, your child will have more experience with computing than many children have in a year at school.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

– Computer literacy: using the keyboard and mouse with ease

– Algorithms: concepts and application

– Beginner coding concepts: conditionals, debugging, sequences and loops

– Programming characters to move and respond

– Identifying and solving problems

– Developing storylines

– Interactive animations

– Designing and creating games

– Touch-typing

– Fundamentals of Robotics

Pre-requisites

This is a course for new coders aged 7 – 10. Students should have experience using a laptop, a keyboard, and a mouse. No coding experience needed!

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Scratch and Robotics Immersive

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Get your child to discover their inner engineer

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

This course is a perfect mixture of computer programming and hands-on engineering that will introduce your child to the basics of coding and robotics.

Our Young Coders will take their first steps into the coding world by learning Scratch – a simple block-based hands-on programming language. We will learn basic coding concepts such as sequencing and debugging, and children will be taught how to move and control sprites and use animations to build interactive storytelling. They will start on building and developing their own games and experience all the fun activities that Scratch has to offer.

In our robotics sessions we will be exploring LEGO WeDo and building robotic LEGO models! LEGO WeDo helps build science, technology and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts. We will learn about Ozobots, build our Mbots, and use our improved Scratch skills to programme our LEGO WeDo creations.

This adventure is fun, entertaining, creative, and most importantly, valuable as children will develop essential computational thinking and creative problem-solving skills. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

– Computer literacy: using the keyboard and mouse with ease

– Algorithms: concepts and application

– Beginner coding concepts: conditionals, debugging, sequences and loops

– Programming characters to move and respond

– Identifying and solving problems

– Developing storylines

– Designing and creating games

– Learning about engines and motors

– Building and programming robots

Pre-requisites

This is a course for new coders aged 7 – 10. Students should have experience using a laptop, a keyboard, and a mouse. No coding experience needed! It is perfect for children who like to work with their hands.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Scratch and Robotics

short_description:
This is a two-week course that will teach you child everything there is to know about games programming with Scratch and robotics. Available for a special price!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

This course is a perfect mixture of computer programming and hands-on engineering that will introduce you child to the basics of coding and robotics. After this 2 week course, your child will be way on their way in having essential programming and robotics skills

First, we will tackle  games programming with Scratch. Scratch builds a strong foundation in computer science and creative problem solving through making animations and games. Your child will learn to create storylines, programme characters and construct their own games.

This course is perfect for beginners and experienced young coders. Each lesson starts at a gentle pace with lots of extension activities to challenge even the most adept young programmer.

We will starting each day teaching  touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games and competing in exciting challenges.

We will also make our own game controllers with Makey Makey: a full programme of building and coding is awaiting our young programmers.

In our robotics sessions we will be exploring LEGO WeDo and building robotic LEGO models! LEGO WeDo helps build science, technology and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts. We will learn about Ozobots, build our Mbots, and use our improved Scratch skills to programme our LEGO WeDo creations.

This adventure is fun, entertaining, creative, and most importantly, valuable as children will develop essential computational thinking and creative problem-solving skills. Instead of gaming, your child will be building and creating!

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

– Computer literacy: using the keyboard and mouse with ease

– Algorithms: concepts and application

– Beginner coding concepts: conditionals, debugging, sequences and loops

– Programming characters to move and respond

– Developing storylines

– Learning about engines and motors

– Building and programming robots

– Identifying and solving problems

– Interactive animations

– Designing and creating games

– Touch-typing

Pre-requisites

This is a course for new coders aged 7 – 10. Students should have experience using a laptop, a keyboard, and a mouse. No coding experience needed! It is perfect for children who like to work with their hands.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Join us at a robotics and coding camp for new coders aged 6 - 8 (Yr. 1 - 3) Students should have experience using a laptop, keyboard and mouse.

name: Scratch and Robotics Immersive

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Enrol your child in a course that will give them a life-long skill as well as bring joy!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 12 pm.

Course Description:

Since computers have become a central part of every child and adult’s day, it is essential to teach them how to use them properly. With so much time spend on the screen, it is important to make sure that your child holds the correct posture and the right way of using the keyboard in order to keep them healthy and make them efficient in the future.

If a week of typing sounds a bit dull – worry not! Children will be learning these essential skills in the format of games, where they will compete against each other, win prizes, and definitely have lots of fun!

Touch Typing is becoming one of the most requested classes, so don’t miss out on the fun learning.

Pre-requisites

This is a course for all levels for children aged 6 – 13.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Touch Typing Intensive

short_description:
This camp is geared towards children in Reception or new coders in Year 1.

Students can sign up for each two day slot as content will vary. Classes are held Monday-Thursday from 10am to 4pm.

Here we introduce your child to logical reasoning and coding concepts. We get them familiar with laptops, the mouse and touch devices such as the iPad.

Basic ICT skills and introductory computing concepts are an important first step for children to be able to grasps the concepts which will be taught in school with the new National Computing Curriculum.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics Covered
– Letter recognition on the keyboard
– Left and right mouse clicks
– Scrolling, browsing and using web browsers
– Internet safety
– Online identity
– Logic games
– What does a computer do
– How does code work
– Intro to algorithms, variables and loops
– Intro to Scratch

Pre-requisites
This is an introductory course and students do not need any previous experience.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack during the morning.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day!

What does a typical day at blue{shift} camp look like?

Download the Daily Camp Schedule for more details.
description:
Classes are held Monday-Thursday from 10am to 4pm.

Course Description
Here we introduce your child to logical reasoning and coding concepts. We get them familiar with laptops, the mouse and touch devices such as the iPad. We introduce Mini Coders to the basic idea of robotics, getting them to make basic circuits and use motors with Lego Wedo.

Basic ICT skills and introductory computing concepts are an important first step for children to be able to grasps the concepts which will be taught in school with the new National Computing Curriculum.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics Covered
– Letter recognition on the keyboard
– Left and right mouse clicks
– Logic games
– What does a computer do
– How does code work
– How does a robot work
– Intro to algorithms, variables and loops
– Intro to Scratch
– What is electricity?
– How does a circuit work?



Pre-requisites
This is an introductory course and students do not need any previous experience with coding. Some activities do require a basic level of reading and writing and this course would be most suited to children who have already started reception. 

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day!

name: April Holiday Camp: Minis

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Launch your kid’s adventure into the digital world!

This is a coding course for new coders aged 6 – 8 (Yr. 1 – 3) Students should have experience using a laptop, keyboard and mouse.

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10am to 4pm.

Course Description

Our Junior Coders will be tackling three topics in their busy days – touch typing, coding and robotics.

We will teach the all important touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games, and competing in exciting challenges.

In our robotics sessions we will be exploring LEGO Wedo, building robotic LEGO models! LEGO Wedo helps build science, technology and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts.

Our third topic will focus on coding games, animations and interactive storytelling in the graphical programming language, Scratch. In Scratch we will learn basic coding concepts – such as sequencing and debugging.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you through Class Dojo and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

Computer literacy: using the keyboard and mouse with ease
Algorithms: concepts and application
Beginner Coding concepts: conditionals, debugging, sequences and loops
Robotics: using input and output devices

Pre-requisites
None! This is for beginners

Laptop Policy: For this class we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day! Early drop off is offered to everybody for the first day of camp (Monday).

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: April Holiday Camp: Robotics and Coding Level 1

short_description:
Is your child Minecraft mad? Turn that love of playing games into a passion for creating them with our four day modding masterclass. Over the week, students will learn how to mod minecraft using Javascript and the Blockly programming language to create amazing new buildings and items in the game.

We’ll cover coding fundamentals such as loops, variables, and conditionals and introduce our coders to the basics of Javascript; all while creating lightning striking wands, lava mountains, skyscrapers and christmas creepers in the game. Unleash your child’s creativity this half term – book now.

 

What is Blockly?

Blockly is a graphical block based programming language designed to ease the transition from
Scratch to Javascript. We use blockly as it allows students to get coding right away
without having to worry about making small syntax errors that can frustrate students when
they first start to code in Javascript.

 

Pre-requisites
Students should have been introduced to Scratch at school or at an after school club or camp. Basic keyboard and mouse skills are required. It’s okay if your child has never played Minecraft before.

 

Laptop Policy: For this class we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however this is subject to availability.

 

Logins and Software: All students should have a working version of Minecraft on their laptops and they will require a purchased account from https://minecraft.net/en
Logins are available to hire for the period of the camp but your child will not be able to use them afterwards.

LearnToMod accounts are included in the price of the camp (usually £30) so your child will be able to continue modding following the workshop.

For more information about LearnToMod please go to https://login-thoughtstem.herokuapp.com/

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!

meta_data.value: Minecraft Modding, 4 days/£445 includes a learning pack and LearnToMod license
